sub_title: Expert on Subsurface, Sustainability and Energy Transition: Energy Storage | Hydrogen | Geothermal | CCS | coordinating international research | #TNOenergytransition
summary:
Serge is employed at TNO as a senior geoscientist and subsurface advisor for the the Dutch government. Besides his day-to-day work at TNO, Serge holds several international positions:
- Chairman Geo-Energy Expert Group at EuroGeoSurveys (European Geological Surveys). 
- Chairman UNFC Injection projects working group at UNECE
- Task Manager Underground Hydrogen Storage at IEA, Hydrogen Technology Collaboration Programme

Serge has a long-term experience as a geoscientist in both shallow and deep subsurface uses. Since 2010 he specifically focuses on subsurface energy technologies and energy transition.

Serge started his career at the former National Geological Survey of the Netherlands (RGD) in 1994 where he worked as a geologist, geophysicist and seismic interpreter on various national and international offshore studies. In 1996 he joined Panterra Geoconsultants where he worked as a geologist for the international oil and gas industry focusing on sedimentology, petrography and reservoir characterization. Serge is working for TNO since 1998. 

Serge van Gessel holds an MSc in earth sciences from the University of Utrecht where he studied Geology from 1988 until 1994. During his study he focused among others on seismic interpretation, sedimentology, structural geology, marine geology, stratigraphy and geological modeling.

EuroGeoSurveys members, the National Geological Surveys, are public sector institutions carrying out operations and research in the field of geosciences. These organisations have a long tradition, in many cases more than 100 years, in collecting data, preparing information and conducting research focused on their national subsurface.

EuroGeoSurveys provides the European Institutions with expert, neutral, balanced and practical pan-European advice and information as an aid to problem-solving, policy, regulatory and programme formulation in many subsurface related areas.
